title: can not restart geth after first close
body:
Hi there,
    I encountered a thorny issue. 
    I downloaded the Windows version of geth from Ethereum and finish synchronized all the nodes. 
    For some reason I must to restart the operating system. So I executed "ctrl + c" in the geth window, but after that geth can not start. 
    The system disk size is 1TB, memory is 16GB, IBM Server r2 ent,.

I am an Ethereum rookie. At present, I have no other solution and information to solve this problem.  if you have links, please share with me,  thank you.

    Start a while will throw the following error:


There is a strange problem here. I donâ€™t have a drive letter "D:\" at all.

Here are some special messages when I started

```
I0626 11:46:43.403018 eth/downloader/downloader.go:319] Block synchronisation started
I0626 11:46:52.401649 eth/handler.go:290] Peer 7b60549e5d789e91 [eth/63]: timed out DAO fork-check, dropping
I0626 11:46:52.401649 eth/downloader/downloader.go:298] Synchronisation failed: block download canceled (requested)
I0626 11:47:11.684142 eth/downloader/downloader.go:298] Synchronisation failed: block header download canceled (requested)
I0626 11:47:44.876977 eth/handler.go:290] Peer 1d475134ac8ffee9 [eth/63]: timed out DAO fork-check, dropping
I0626 11:48:04.180490 eth/downloader/queue.go:885] Peer 01fb8ed0109ca731: header #2309501 [965c4325] broke chain ancestry
I0626 11:48:05.056332 eth/downloader/queue.go:885] Peer 01fb8ed0109ca731: header #2322596 [2430d2c6] broke chain ancestry
I0626 11:48:07.137326 eth/downloader/queue.go:885] Peer 01fb8ed0109ca731: header #2336219 [6c568ae5] broke chain ancestry
I0626 11:48:07.891049 eth/downloader/queue.go:885] Peer 01fb8ed0109ca731: header #2345248 [3304a853] broke chain ancestry
```
Please paste the entire crash dump. The beginning of it is the most interesting as that contains the actual crash.

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have or find the answers we need so that we can investigate further.
